item.title: Ultra Pro Announces Official Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy Accessories
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/news/ultra-pro-announces-official-magic-gathering-final-fantasy-accessories

An official Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy accessory line is coming. The ubiquitous tabletop accessory company Ultra Pro is creating an official product line of deck boxes and sleeves to commemorate the crossover of two iconic franchises.

The Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy Accessory Line Announcement

According to an official press release, Ultra Pro is producing an official line of Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy accessories. They are designed not just to protect and preserve any important or rare cards you might get from the latest crossover set, but also serve as collector's items in their own right.

The official product in the Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy accessory line-up sports two of Final Fantasy's most iconic characters. One is he hero of Final Fantasy VII: Cloud Strife. The other features Final Fantasy VII's villain: the One-Winged Angel Sephiroth. The product line up is as follows:

  • Deck Protector Sleeves
  • Deck Box Storage Containers
  • Premium Deck Boxes
  • Several Multi-Pocket Card Binders. A 4-Pocket Binder, a 9-Pocket Binder, and a 12-Pocket Binder Respectively
  • Spiral Life Pad
  • Flat Pack Storage Box
  • 6ft Table Playmat
  • 8ft Table Playmat
  • Standard Playmat
  • Double-Sided Playmat
  • Holofoil Playmat
  • Black-Stitched Playmat

The production of a Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy accessory line was expected given the pedigree of both series. Magic: The Gathering debuted in 1993 and is widely considered one of the most popular TCGs of all time. For over 30 years, it has entertained millions of players with accessible gameplay, complex epic fantasy lore, and crossovers with other properties like Lord of the Rings and Doctor Who.

Alternatively, Final Fantasy is one of the most beloved and enduring RPG series in the world. It debuted in 1987 on the NES and has slowly expanded into a sprawling series packed with iconic characters, imaginative worlds, and compelling storytelling. It has produced sixteen mainline entries and several spin-offs like Final Fantasy Tactics.

The Magic: The Gathering Final Fantasy crossover set will release June 13. 

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. Thisâ€¦ More about Tyler
